module.name: finishLineDetector
module.description: This module takes as input the RGB image containing a set of markers and publishes the estimated pose of the markers with respect to the robot camera and root.
module.copypolicy: Released under the terms of the BSD 3-Clause License.
module.description-long:
This module takes as input the RGB image containing a set of markers and publishes the estimated pose of the markers with respect to the camera and to robot root. It makes use of an OpenCV ArUco Board of 6x1 markers. The used board can be found in `app/conf` (the two images were sticked togheter for printing a marker big enough to be visible from a certain distance). The detected finish line is published into the \ref objectsPropertiesCollector, with the pose estimated with respect to the robot camera (`pose_camera`) and to the robot root (`pose_root`), as following:
\code ((finish-line (pose_camera (x y z ax ay az theta)) (pose_root (x y z ax ay az theta))) (id opc_id)) \endcode

input.description: Retrieves the current pose of the camera.
